basics.name: Elora Schoerverth
basics.label: Applied AI Engineer
basics.summary: Specializing in machine learning and document processing. Also passionate about medical ML and space.

work.name: Workist
highlights: Collaborated on transitioning to a new token classification model, improving F1 score from 0.86 to 0.938 through fine-tuning and evaluation.
Experimented with models for object detection and document/email classification to optimize AI capabilities.
Enhanced machine learning monitoring pipelines to ensure reliability and performance.
Contributed to backend development, including bug fixes, improved post-processing, and customer-specific adjustments.

work.name: Fraunhofer HHI
work.summary: Worked on the SyReal project focusing on generative models for synthetic histopathological imaging.
highlights: Trained and evaluated diffusion models; developed interpretability methods for generative processes.
Contributed to XAI interface development for diffusion models in healthcare applications.
Leveraged tools like PyTorch, AWS SageMaker, and Python for experimentation and deployment.

work.name: Fraunhofer HHI
work.summary: Developed an assessment platform for evaluating machine learning models in healthcare.
highlights: Led the development of an ML model assessment platform integrated with ITU/WHO AI4H guidelines.
Improved evaluation efficiency and platform reliability.
Utilized technologies including Python, Docker, AWS, Django, and AngularJS.

education.summary: Master's thesis: 'An XAI Interface for Diffusion Models.'
Bachelor's thesis: 'Development of a Web Application for Supervising the Progression of Parkinson's Disease in Patients.'

publications.name: Machine Learning for Health (ML4H) 2022
publications.summary: Contributed to proceedings on algorithm auditing and quality control in healthcare.

publications.name: Machine Learning for Health: Algorithm Auditing & Quality Control
publications.summary: Focused on quality control methodologies for ML systems in health.
